canonical_explanation.text: Time tells us when things happen. During the day it is light because the sun is out, and during the night it is dark. There are 7 days in a week: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. A year has 12 months. There are different seasons like summer, winter, rainy and spring. We use the words yesterday, today and tomorrow to talk about days that have passed, the present day and the next day. A clock has two hands: a short hand (hour hand) and a long hand (minute hand). When the long hand points to 12, we read the hour that the short hand points to and say o'clock. For example, if the short hand points to 3 and the long hand points to 12, the time is 3 o'clock.
rules: Day is when it is light outside and night is when it is dark.
There are 7 days in a week: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
A year has 12 months: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December.
Yesterday is the day before today. Tomorrow is the day after today.
A clock has a short hand (hour hand) and a long hand (minute hand).
When the long hand points to 12, read the number the short hand points to and say o'clock.
We do different activities at different times of the day: morning, afternoon, evening and night.

questions.question_text: When is it light outside?
questions.explanation_correct: During the day, the sun is out and it is light outside. This is because the sun provides light and warmth during the day, making it bright and clear outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not light outside during the night because the sun is not out at that time. The night is dark because the sun has set and there is no natural light. The correct answer is that it is light outside during the day when the sun is shining.

questions.question_text: The sun gives us light during the day.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun gives us light during the day because the sun is up in the sky during the day. The sun makes the sky bright and the earth light up, so we can see things clearly during the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not give us light during the night. At night, the sun is not up in the sky, so the sky is dark. We use other light sources like the moon and streetlights to see things at night.

questions.question_text: It is dark outside during the day.
questions.explanation_correct: During the day, the sun is out and it is bright outside. It is only dark outside at night when the sun is not shining.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, it is not dark outside during the day. During the day, the sun is out and it makes the outside bright and light. It is only dark outside at night when the sun goes down.

questions.question_text: When the sun goes down, ___ begins.
questions.explanation_correct: When the sun goes down, it becomes dark outside. This time of day is called night, so the correct answer is 'night'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The wrong answer is 'day'. During the day, the sun is out and it is bright outside. But when the sun goes down, it becomes dark outside and this time is called 'night'. The correct answer is 'night'.

questions.question_text: When can you see the moon and stars in the sky?
questions.explanation_correct: You can see the moon and stars in the sky at night because it is dark at night. During the day, the sun is out so we cannot see the moon and stars as clearly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The moon and stars are not visible in the sky during the afternoon, morning, or at noon. This is because the sun is out and bright during those times of the day, so we cannot see the moon and stars as clearly. The best time to see the moon and stars is at night when it is dark.

questions.question_text: How many days are there in a week?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 7 days in a week. This includes Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. Option C is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 7 days in a week. Options A, B, and D are incorrect because there are not 5, 6, or 10 days in a week. There are always 7 days in a week, from Sunday to Saturday.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a day of the week?
questions.explanation_correct: Wednesday is a day of the week, so the correct answer is C. The other options like January, Summer, and Morning are not days of the week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C. Wednesday is a day of the week, like Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. The other options like January, Summer, and Morning are not days of the week.

questions.question_text: Which day comes right after Wednesday?
questions.explanation_correct: The day right after Wednesday is Thursday. This is because the days of the week go in the order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the next day after Wednesday is Thursday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Thursday, not A) Tuesday, C) Friday, or D) Monday. This is because the days of the week go in the order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day right after Wednesday is Thursday.

questions.question_text: The day after Monday is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The day after Monday is Tuesday. This is because the days of the week go in the order: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. So the next day after Monday is Tuesday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The day after Monday is not Wednesday. The days of the week go in the order: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. So the correct answer is Tuesday, not Wednesday.

questions.question_text: The day before Saturday is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The day before Saturday is Friday because the days of the week go in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day right before Saturday is Friday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The day before Saturday is not Thursday. The days of the week go in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day right before Saturday is Friday, not Thursday.

questions.question_text: Sunday is a day of the week.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, Sunday is a day of the week. There are 7 days in a week, and Sunday is the first day of the week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, Sunday is not a day of the week. There are actually 7 days in a week: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. Sunday is the first day of the week, so it is a day of the week.

questions.question_text: Friday comes right after Monday.
questions.explanation_correct: Friday does not come right after Monday. The days of the week go in order: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. So Friday comes after Thursday, not Monday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The days of the week go in order: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. So Friday does not come right after Monday. There are 3 days (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday) between Monday and Friday.

questions.question_text: Arrange these days in the correct order, starting from Monday.
questions.explanation_correct: The days of the week are in order: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday. This is the correct order because the days always follow this sequence.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order of the days is Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday. This is because the days of the week always come in this order. Wednesday comes after Tuesday, and Friday comes after Wednesday.

questions.question_text: Arrange these days in the correct order of the week, starting from the earliest.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of the days of the week, starting from the earliest, is: Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday. This is because each day of the week comes after the previous one, and Sunday is the first day of the week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order of the days of the week, starting from the earliest, is: Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday. This is because the days of the week always go in the order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So, the correct order of the days given is Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday.

questions.question_text: How many months are there in a year?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 12 months in a year. This is because there are 12 different months in a calendar year, like January, February, March, and so on.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 12 months in a year. This is not 7 months, 10 months, or 15 months. There are 12 months in a year, starting from January and ending in December. Each month has a different name and a different number of days.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the first month of the year?
questions.explanation_correct: January is the first month of the year. This is because the year starts in January, so January is always the first month of the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: March, December, and April are not the first month of the year. The first month of the year is always January. This is because the year starts in January, so January comes before all the other months.

questions.question_text: The last month of the year is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The last month of the year is December. This is correct because there are 12 months in a year, and December is the 12th and final month of the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is December. December is the 12th month of the year, so it is the last month. The other months are January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, and November. December comes after November, so it is the last month of the year.

questions.question_text: In summer the weather is very hot.
questions.explanation_correct: In summer, the weather is very hot because the sun shines brightly and the temperature is high. This is why the statement 'In summer the weather is very hot' is true.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The weather is not always hot in summer. In some places, it can be rainy or even cool during the summer months. The correct answer is that the statement 'In summer the weather is very hot' is true because the sun shines brightly and the temperature is high during the summer season.

questions.question_text: Arrange these months in the correct order, starting from the earliest.
questions.explanation_correct: The months are arranged in the correct order, starting from January, the first month of the year, then February, March, and June. This is the right order because the months go in numerical order from 1 to 12 throughout the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The months are not in the correct order. The order should be January, February, March, June. January is the first month of the year, followed by February, March, and then June. The months should be arranged in numerical order from the start of the year.

questions.question_text: What do we call the day before today?
questions.explanation_correct: The day before today is called yesterday. Yesterday is the day that came before the present day, which is today.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tomorrow is the day that comes after today, not the day before today. The day before today is called yesterday. Yesterday is the day that came before the present day, which is today.

questions.question_text: The day after today is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The day after today is called 'tomorrow' because 'tomorrow' is the next day that comes after today. We use the word 'tomorrow' to talk about the next day that will come.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The day after today is not called 'yesterday'. 'Yesterday' is the day before today. The correct answer is 'tomorrow' because 'tomorrow' is the day that comes after today.

questions.question_text: If today is Tuesday, what day was yesterday?
questions.explanation_correct: If today is Tuesday, then yesterday was Monday. This is because each day comes after the previous day, so the day before Tuesday is Monday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If today is Tuesday, then yesterday was not Wednesday, Thursday, or Sunday. This is because Wednesday, Thursday, and Sunday all come after Tuesday in the week. The day before Tuesday is Monday, so the correct answer is B) Monday.

questions.question_text: Yesterday is the day that comes after today.
questions.explanation_correct: Today is the present day, yesterday is the day that came before today, and tomorrow is the day that will come after today. So yesterday is not the day that comes after today.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yesterday is the day that came before today. Tomorrow is the day that will come after today. So yesterday is not the day that comes after today, it is the day that came before today.

questions.question_text: If today is Thursday, then yesterday was ___.
questions.explanation_correct: If today is Thursday, then the day before today (yesterday) must have been Wednesday. The days of the week go in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day before Thursday is Wednesday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If today is Thursday, then yesterday was not Monday or Friday. The day before Thursday is always Wednesday. The days of the week go in order, so the day before Thursday has to be Wednesday.

questions.question_text: Arrange in the correct order of time: tomorrow, yesterday, today.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'yesterday, today, tomorrow' because yesterday is the day that came before today, today is the present day, and tomorrow is the next day that will come after today.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order 'tomorrow, yesterday, today' is incorrect because tomorrow comes after today, yesterday comes before today, and today is the present day. The days need to be in the order of past, present, and future.

questions.question_text: A clock has two hands. The short hand is called the:
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand is called the hour hand because it tells us what hour it is. When the hour hand points to a number, that number shows the hour of the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The long hand is called the minute hand, not the short hand. The short hand is called the hour hand because it moves more slowly and points to the hour on the clock face. The second hand is the hand that moves very quickly and shows the seconds.

questions.question_text: When the long hand points to 12 and the short hand points to 5, the time is:
questions.explanation_correct: When the long hand (minute hand) points to 12, it means the time is on the hour. And when the short hand (hour hand) points to 5, it means the time is 5 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is not correct because when the long hand points to 12, it means the time is on the hour, not 12 o'clock. Option C is not correct because when the short hand points to 5, the time is 5 o'clock, not 7 o'clock. Option D is not correct because when the short hand points to 5, the time is 5 o'clock, not 2 o'clock.

questions.question_text: When the long hand points to 12 and the short hand points to 3, the time is ___ o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: When the long hand points to 12 and the short hand points to 3, the time is 3 o'clock because the short hand shows the hour, and it is pointing to the number 3. So the time is 3 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 3 o'clock. The long hand is pointing to 12, which means it is the hour mark. The short hand is pointing to the number 3, so the time is 3 o'clock. The answer should be written as '3' to match the exact format.

questions.question_text: The ___ hand on a clock is the long hand.
questions.explanation_correct: The minute hand is the long hand on a clock. This is because the minute hand shows the minutes, which are smaller units of time compared to the hours shown by the short hand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand on a clock is the hour hand, not the minute hand. The minute hand is the long hand that moves around the clock to show the minutes. For example, if the short hand points to 3 and the long hand points to 12, the time is 3 o'clock.

questions.question_text: The hour hand on a clock is the short hand.
questions.explanation_correct: The hour hand on a clock is the short hand. This is because the hour hand moves more slowly than the long minute hand, and it points to the hour of the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The long hand on a clock is the minute hand, not the hour hand. The short hand is the hour hand because it moves more slowly and points to the hour of the day. The long hand moves quickly and points to the minutes on the clock.

questions.question_text: When the long hand points to 12 and the short hand points to 7, the time is 12 o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: When the long hand points to 12 and the short hand points to 7, the time is 7 o'clock, not 12 o'clock. The short hand shows the hour, and it is pointing to 7, so the time is 7 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When the long hand points to 12, we read the hour that the short hand is pointing to. In this case, the short hand is pointing to 7, so the time is 7 o'clock, not 12 o'clock. The long hand is just used to show the minutes, not the hour.

questions.question_text: The short hand points to 10 and the long hand points to 12. What time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand points to 10, so the time is 10 o'clock. This is because the short hand represents the hour and the long hand points to 12, which means it is the 10th hour of the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand points to 10, so it is not 12 o'clock, 2 o'clock, or 8 o'clock. The correct answer is 10 o'clock because the short hand shows the hour, and it is pointing to the 10th hour of the day.

questions.question_text: The short hand is at 6 and the long hand is at 12. The time is ___ o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand is at 6, so the time is 6 o'clock. When the short hand points to a number, that number is the hour we say the time is.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 6 o'clock. The short hand is pointing to the 6, so the time is 6 o'clock. Even though the long hand is pointing to 12, we look at the short hand to know the hour.

questions.question_text: Aman wakes up when the short hand is at 6 and the long hand is at 12. He goes to school when the short hand is at 8 and the long hand is at 12. At what time does Aman go to school?
questions.explanation_correct: Aman goes to school when the short hand is at 8 and the long hand is at 12, which is 8 o'clock. This is the correct answer because the clock shows 8 o'clock when the short hand is pointing to 8 and the long hand is pointing to 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. 6 o'clock is when Aman wakes up, not when he goes to school. 12 o'clock is not the right time either. 2 o'clock is not shown on the clock in the question.

questions.question_text: Priya eats lunch at 12 o'clock. On her clock, where will the short hand point?
questions.explanation_correct: When the long hand (minute hand) points to 12, the time is 12 o'clock. Since Priya eats lunch at 12 o'clock, the short hand (hour hand) will be pointing to 12 on her clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand (hour hand) does not point to 3 or 1 at 12 o'clock. It points to 12 because 12 o'clock is the time when the long hand (minute hand) is at 12. So, the short hand (hour hand) will be pointing to 12.

questions.question_text: Neha's class starts at 9 o'clock. On her clock the short hand will point to ___ and the long hand will point to 12.
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand on the clock points to the hour, and the long hand points to the 12 when it is o'clock. Since Neha's class starts at 9 o'clock, the short hand will point to 9 and the long hand will point to 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 9. The short hand on the clock shows the hour, and the long hand points to 12 when it is o'clock. Since Neha's class starts at 9 o'clock, the short hand will be pointing to 9 and the long hand will be pointing to 12.

questions.question_text: At 4 o'clock, the short hand points to 4 and the long hand points to 12.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the answer is true. At 4 o'clock, the short hand points to the 4 and the long hand points to the 12. This is because the short hand moves one number for each hour, and the long hand goes all the way around the clock in one hour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not false. Some students might think the short hand should point to the number 4, but that's not correct. The short hand moves slowly and points to the hour, so at 4 o'clock, the short hand will be pointing between the 3 and the 4.

questions.question_text: At 3 o'clock, the long hand points to 3.
questions.explanation_correct: At 3 o'clock, the long hand (minute hand) points to 12, not 3. The short hand (hour hand) points to the 3, which tells us the time is 3 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The long hand (minute hand) on the clock does not point to the same number as the hour. At 3 o'clock, the long hand points to 12, while the short hand (hour hand) points to the 3. So the long hand is not pointing to 3 at 3 o'clock.

questions.question_text: Arrange these times from earliest to latest: 9 o'clock, 3 o'clock, 6 o'clock, 1 o'clock.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from earliest to latest is 1 o'clock, 3 o'clock, 6 o'clock, and 9 o'clock. This is because as the hour hand moves, the time gets later in the day. 1 o'clock is the earliest, followed by 3 o'clock, 6 o'clock, and then 9 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 9 o'clock, 6 o'clock, 3 o'clock, 1 o'clock. This is wrong because the time gets later as the hour hand moves. 9 o'clock is the latest time, not the earliest. 6 o'clock comes before 3 o'clock, and 1 o'clock is the earliest time in the list.

questions.question_text: When do we usually eat breakfast?
questions.explanation_correct: We usually eat breakfast in the morning because that is the first meal of the day. Breakfast helps us start the day with energy and nutrition.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not usually eat breakfast at night, in the afternoon, or at midnight. Breakfast is the meal we have in the morning, when the sun is up and the day is just beginning. This gives us the energy we need to start our day.

questions.question_text: Arrange these daily activities in the order they usually happen: go to sleep, eat breakfast, eat lunch, wake up.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'wake up', 'eat breakfast', 'eat lunch', 'go to sleep' because this is the usual order of our daily activities. We wake up in the morning, then eat breakfast, then later in the day we eat lunch, and finally we go to sleep at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order is 'go to sleep', 'eat breakfast', 'eat lunch', 'wake up'. This is not the right order because we always wake up first, then eat breakfast, then later eat lunch, and finally go to sleep at night. The correct order is 'wake up', 'eat breakfast', 'eat lunch', 'go to sleep'.

questions.question_text: Arrange these times of day in the correct order: evening, morning, night, afternoon.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is morning, afternoon, evening, night. This is because the day starts with morning, then moves to afternoon, then evening, and finally night. Each part of the day comes after the previous one in this order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be something like night, morning, afternoon, evening. This is not correct because the day starts with morning, not night. The order of the day is morning, afternoon, evening, and then night. So the correct order is morning, afternoon, evening, and night.

questions.question_text: What is the the day that comes right after it of Monday?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is Tuesday, because the day that comes right after Monday is Tuesday. The days of the week go in order: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because Thursday is two days after Monday, Sunday is the day after Saturday, and Saturday is the day before Sunday. The day that comes right after Monday is Tuesday.

questions.question_text: What is the the day that comes right after it of Wednesday?
questions.explanation_correct: The day that comes right after Wednesday is Thursday. This is because there are 7 days in a week, and each day comes after the previous one in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Thursday. Wednesday is followed by Thursday, not Saturday, Tuesday, or Sunday. The days of the week go in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day that comes after Wednesday is Thursday.

questions.question_text: What is the the day that comes right after it of Friday?
questions.explanation_correct: The day that comes right after Friday is Saturday. This is because the days of the week go in the order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day after Friday is Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are Sunday, Thursday, and Tuesday. These are not the days that come right after Friday. The days of the week go in the order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. So the day that comes right after Friday is Saturday.

questions.question_text: What is the the day that comes right after it of Saturday?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) Sunday. After Saturday, the next day is Sunday. The days of the week go in order: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and then the cycle repeats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because Thursday, Tuesday, and Saturday are not the days that come right after Saturday. The days of the week go in order, and the day that comes after Saturday is Sunday.

questions.question_text: Where does 3 o'clock live?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand on the clock points to 3 when the time is 3 o'clock. So the correct answer is A, where the short hand is at 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand on the clock tells the hour. When the short hand points to 8, the time is 8 o'clock. When the short hand points to 12, the time is 12 o'clock. The short hand does not point to 5 for 3 o'clock. The correct answer is A, where the short hand is at 3.

questions.question_text: Where does 8 o'clock live?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Short hand at 8. This is because when the short hand (hour hand) is pointing to 8, it is 8 o'clock. The time is read by the position of the short hand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are: A) Short hand at 5 - this would be 5 o'clock, not 8 o'clock. B) Short hand at 12 - this would be 12 o'clock, not 8 o'clock. D) Short hand at 3 - this would be 3 o'clock, not 8 o'clock. The correct answer is C) Short hand at 8, because this is where the hour hand points when it is 8 o'clock.

questions.question_text: Where does 12 o'clock live?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand points to 12 at 12 o'clock, so the time is 12 o'clock. This is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand points to 12 at 12 o'clock, not at 8, 3, or 5. When the short hand is at 12, it is 12 o'clock. The other options are not the correct time for when the short hand is at 12.

questions.question_text: Where does 5 o'clock live?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand on the clock points to 5 when the time is 5 o'clock. This means the short hand shows the hour, and when it points to 5, the time is 5 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand on the clock does not point to 3, 12, or 8 when it is 5 o'clock. The short hand always shows the hour, and when it points to 5, the time is 5 o'clock.

questions.question_text: What time does Eat breakfast show?
questions.explanation_correct: Breakfast is eaten in the morning, so the time 'Eat breakfast' shows is in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating breakfast is not something that happens in the evening, afternoon or at night. Breakfast is the first meal of the day and is eaten in the morning, usually around 7 or 8 o'clock.

questions.question_text: What time does Go to sleep show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) Night because 'go to sleep' usually happens at night when it's dark outside and we are tired and ready to rest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because morning, afternoon, and evening are times of the day when we are usually awake and active. 'Go to sleep' refers to the time when we are ready to rest at night, so the correct answer is D) Night.

questions.question_text: What time does Eat lunch show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) Afternoon because 'Eat lunch' typically happens in the afternoon, when the sun is high in the sky and it is daytime.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not A) Night, because 'Eat lunch' happens during the day, not at night. The answer is also not B) Morning or C) Evening, because lunch is usually eaten in the afternoon, not in the morning or evening.

questions.question_text: What time does Come home from school show?
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is A) Evening because students typically come home from school in the afternoon or evening, not in the morning or night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not B) Night or D) Morning because students are usually at school during those times. The answer is also not C) Afternoon because that is when students are still at school, not coming home from it. The correct answer is A) Evening, when students have finished their school day and are returning home.

questions.question_text: What time does Sun is shining show?
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun shining shows that it is day time. During the day, the Sun is out and shining, which makes it bright outside. This tells us that the correct answer is A) Day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sun shining does not show that it is night time. At night, the Sun is not out and it is dark outside. The correct answer is A) Day, because the Sun shining is a sign that it is daytime.

questions.question_text: What time does Stars are in the sky show?
questions.explanation_correct: The stars are in the sky at night, not during the day. This is because at night when it is dark, we can see the stars shining in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stars are not in the sky during the day because it is too bright outside. The sun is shining and the sky is light, so we cannot see the stars during the day. At night, when it is dark, the stars come out and we can see them in the sky.

questions.question_text: What time does It is bright outside show?
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is A) Day because when it is bright outside, it means the sun is shining, and that happens during the day. At night, it is dark outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not B) Night. When it is bright outside, it means it is daytime, not nighttime. At night, it is dark because the sun has gone down.

questions.question_text: What time does It is dark outside show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) Night. When it is dark outside, that means it is nighttime, not daytime. During the night, the sun is not out, so it is dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is B) Day. When it is dark outside, that does not mean it is daytime. Daytime is when the sun is out and it is bright outside. Nighttime is when it is dark outside, because the sun has gone down.

questions.question_text: What is the what we feel or see of Summer?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C, 'Very hot weather'. This is because summer is the season when the weather is very hot and sunny, not cold, rainy or filled with blooming flowers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer A, 'Very cold weather', is incorrect because summer is the hot season, not the cold season. The answer B, 'Flowers bloom', is incorrect because flowers bloom more in spring, not summer. The answer D, 'Lots of rain', is incorrect because summer is usually a dry season with little rain.

questions.question_text: What is the what we feel or see of Winter?
questions.explanation_correct: Winter is a season when the weather is very cold. This is the correct answer because during winter, the temperature drops and it feels very cold outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The weather during winter is not very hot or full of rain. It is cold and chilly. Flowers also do not bloom during the winter season, as the plants and trees are resting during this time. So the correct answer is that the weather during winter is very cold.

questions.question_text: What is the what we feel or see of Rainy season?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) Lots of rain. During the rainy season, we see and feel a lot of rain. This is because it is the season when a lot of rain falls from the clouds in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The rainy season is not characterized by very cold weather (option B) or very hot weather (option C). The rainy season is known for having a lot of rain, with water falling from the clouds. Flowers blooming (option D) is more associated with the spring season, not the rainy season.

questions.question_text: What is the what we feel or see of Spring?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Flowers bloom because spring is a time when the weather gets warmer and plants start growing new flowers and leaves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A) Very cold weather is not spring, that is winter. C) Very hot weather is not spring, that is summer. D) Lots of rain is not specifically spring, as it can rain a lot in other seasons too. The main thing we see and feel in spring is that flowers start blooming and growing again after the colder winter months.

questions.question_text: What time does Short hand at 2, long hand at 12 show?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand is pointing to 2, so the time is 2 o'clock. This is because the short hand shows the hour, and when it points to 2, the time is 2 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) 2 o'clock. The short hand is pointing to 2, which means the hour is 2. The long hand is pointing to 12, which means it is exactly 2 o'clock. The other options are not correct because the short hand is not pointing to those hours.

questions.question_text: What time does Short hand at 7, long hand at 12 show?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand is pointing to 7, so the time is 7 o'clock. When the long hand points to 12, it shows the hour that the short hand is pointing to.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The short hand is pointing to 7, not 4, so the time is not 4 o'clock. The short hand shows the hour, and when the long hand points to 12, it shows the hour that the short hand is pointing to, which is 7 o'clock.

questions.question_text: What time does Short hand at 11, long hand at 12 show?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand is pointing to 11, which means it is 11 o'clock. When the long hand points to 12, it shows the exact hour that the short hand is pointing to, which is 11 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option D is correct because the short hand is pointing to 11, and when the long hand is pointing to 12, it shows the exact hour that the short hand is pointing to, which is 11 o'clock. Options A, B, and C are incorrect because they show different times that are not what the clock is showing.

questions.question_text: What time does Short hand at 4, long hand at 12 show?
questions.explanation_correct: When the short hand (hour hand) points to 4 and the long hand (minute hand) points to 12, it shows the time is 4 o'clock. The short hand tells us the hour, and when it points to 4, the time is 4 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option C, 4 o'clock, is the correct answer. The short hand (hour hand) is pointing to 4, so the time is 4 o'clock. Option A (2 o'clock) is incorrect because the short hand is not pointing to 2. Option B (11 o'clock) is incorrect because the short hand is not pointing to 11. Option D (7 o'clock) is incorrect because the short hand is not pointing to 7.

questions.question_text: What time does Wake up show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 6 o'clock because the short hand (hour hand) on the clock is pointing to the 6, which means it is 6 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) 6 o'clock. The clock in the image shows the long hand (minute hand) pointing to 12 and the short hand (hour hand) pointing to 6, which means it is 6 o'clock. Options B) 8 o'clock, C) 12 o'clock, and D) 9 o'clock are incorrect because the clock does not show those times.

questions.question_text: What time does Go to school show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) 8 o'clock. This is because the time to go to school is usually in the morning, and the short hand points to the 8 on the clock, which means it is 8 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Option A) 6 o'clock is too early to go to school, option B) 12 o'clock is noon, and option C) 9 o'clock is too late for school. The correct time to go to school is 8 o'clock, when the short hand points to the 8 on the clock.

questions.question_text: What time does Eat lunch show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 12 o'clock. This is because the time 'Eat lunch' is usually around noon, when the clock shows 12 o'clock or midday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. A) 8 o'clock is too early for lunch, B) 6 o'clock is dinner time, and D) 9 o'clock is also too early for lunch. The correct time for 'Eat lunch' is 12 o'clock, when the clock shows the short hand pointing to 12.

questions.question_text: What time does Go to sleep show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) 9 o'clock. The image 'Go to sleep' shows a clock with the short hand pointing to 9 and the long hand pointing to 12, which means it is 9 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not match the time shown on the clock in the image. A) 6 o'clock is wrong because the short hand is not pointing to 6. B) 12 o'clock is wrong because the short hand is not pointing to 12. C) 8 o'clock is wrong because the short hand is not pointing to 8.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Yesterday?
questions.explanation_correct: Yesterday means the day before today. So the day before the present day is called 'yesterday'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A, 'This day', is not correct because yesterday refers to the day before today. Option B, 'The week before this week', is not correct because yesterday is just the day before today, not the whole week. Option C, 'The day after today', is not correct because yesterday is the day before today, not the day after.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Today?
questions.explanation_correct: Today means 'this day', the day that is happening right now. The correct answer is D because today refers to the current day, not the past (yesterday) or the future (tomorrow).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A) refers to the week before this week, which is not the meaning of today. B) refers to yesterday, the day before today. C) refers to tomorrow, the day after today. The correct answer is D because today means 'this day', the day that is happening right now.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Tomorrow?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) The day after today. Tomorrow means the next day, or the day after today. This is because we use the word 'tomorrow' to talk about the future, or the day that comes after the current day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A) This day means 'today', not tomorrow. B) The week before this week is 'last week', not tomorrow. C) The day before today is 'yesterday', not tomorrow. So the correct answer is D) The day after today, which is the meaning of the word 'tomorrow'.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Last week?
questions.explanation_correct: Last week means the week before this current week. So 'Last week' refers to the week that came before the present week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options do not correctly describe what 'last week' means. Option A refers to tomorrow, which is not the same as last week. Option C refers to today, not last week. Option D refers to yesterday, not last week. 'Last week' specifically means the week that came before the current week.
